titles: Certain disquisitions and considerations representing to the conscience the unlawfulnesse of the oath, entituled, A solemn League and Covenant for reformation &c. As also the insufficiency of the arguments used in the exhortation for taking the said Covenant. Published by command.
author: Barwick, John, 1612-1664.
publisher: Printed by Leonard Lichfield printer to the University,
notes: By John Barwick, with the assistance of William Lacey, Isaac Barrow, Seth Ward, Edmund Balders, William Quarles, and Peter Gunning.
The imprint is false; printed in London (Madan).
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Said to be written by the Universitie of Cambridge"; "Aprill 17th".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Solemn League and Covenant (1643). --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  Politics and government --  1642-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
